definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess

sentences.english: He's found out about the ruse, but his demands for an apartment haven't wavered.
sentences.chinese: 张炘炀识破了这个花招，没有动摇自己的主张。

sentences.english: Basketball fans miss Magic Johnson 's razzle dazzle in the game.
sentences.chinese: 篮球迷们怀念魔术师强纳生球赛中的花招。

sentences.english: You see, Jane, you cannot try your tricks on Mr Brocklehurst.
sentences.chinese: 你不能在布鲁克赫斯特先生那儿耍花招。

sentences.english: The promotion department drummed up obvious stunts.
sentences.chinese: 公关宣传部门显然耍起了引人注目的花招。

sentences.english: I am the old man. I know hocus-pocus.
sentences.chinese: 我是个老人，我懂这些花招。

sentences.english: Don't try to cheat on your income tax, or you could get into hot water .
sentences.chinese: 不要在所得税上耍花招，否则你会有麻烦。

sentences.english: Watch more examples of ball and cup routines in this free sleight of hand magic tricks video.
sentences.chinese: 观看更多的例子球及杯例程这手魔术视频免费花招。

sentences.english: Lest I should know you too easily, you play with me.
sentences.chinese: 只恐我太轻易地认得你，你对我耍花招。

sentences.english: He was unable to think up a new trick and went away.
sentences.chinese: 他无法再想出新的花招来，就讪讪地溜走了。

sentences.english: He is up to his tricks again.
That was a contemptible trick to play on a friend.
sentences.chinese: 对朋友耍花招是卑鄙的。

sentences.english: Try any sleight of hand with my money and I'll cut your throat.
sentences.chinese: 敢对我的钱耍什么花招的话，我就剪断你的喉咙。

sentences.english: I know their tricks and stratagems.
sentences.chinese: 我对他们的花招和战略洞若观火。

sentences.english: I'm really tired of your ploys.
sentences.chinese: 我对你的花招实在厌倦了。

sentences.english: My stunt showed me the disfiguring power of deception.
sentences.chinese: 我的花招为我展示出了欺骗中的扭曲力量。

definition: move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 著數|着数[zhao1 shu4]
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
pattern/way of doing sth/trick/(sports) fancy-style (as figure skating etc)
to play with/to engage in/to resort to/to dally with
